IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: TO BE THE BEST SCHOOL FOR BOYS BY CULTIVATING YOUNG MEN OF INTEGRITY AND BY PROVIDING A STRUCTURED, SUPPORTIVE, LEARNING ENVIRONMENT THAT ENCOURAGES SELF-DISCOVERY AND SOCIAL RESPONSIBILITY.
IRS990.MissionDesc: AVON OLD FARMS SCHOOL STRIVES TO BE THE BEST COLLEGE PREPARATORY SCHOOL FOR BOYS BY CULTIVATING YOUNG MEN OF INTEGRITY, WHO HONOR WISDOM, JUSTICE, INCLUSION, SERVICE, AND THE PURSUIT OF TRUTH.
IRS990.Desc: INDEPENDENT SECONDARY SCHOOL WITH 307 BOARDING STUDENTS AND 103 DAY STUDENTS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: INCOME FROM THE SCHOOL'S ENDOWMENT FUND IS APPROPRIATED FOR STUDENT FINANCIAL AID, FACULTY SALARIES AND BENEFITS AS WELL AS OTHER OPERATING EXPENSES OF THE SCHOOL, IN ACCORDANCE WITH DONOR-IMPOSED RESTRICTIONS AND THE SCHOOL'S BOARD APPROVED SPENDING POLICY.

the school has no unrecognized tax benefits at June 30, 2016 and 2015. the school's u.s. federal information returns prior to fiscal year 2013 are closed and management continually evaluates expiring statutes of limitations, audits, proposed settlements, changes in tax law and new authoritative rulings. if the school had unrelated business income taxes, it would recognize interest and penalties associated with any tax matters as part of the income tax provision and include accrued interest and penalties with the related tax liability in the statement of financial position.
The nondiscriminatory policy is published in all school catalogues and brochures.

AccountActivitiesOutsideUSGrp.RegionTxt: East Asia and the Pacific - Australia, Brunei, Burma, Cambodia,
Russia and Neighboring States - Armenia, Azerbijan, Belarus,
Europe (Including Iceland & Greenland) - Albania, Andorra, Austria, Belgium

GrantsOtherAsstToIndivInUSGrp.NonCashAssistanceDesc: scholarships & grants are provided to students via a waiver of tuition, fees and other charges.

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: all financial aid recipients are required to complete a financial aid statement and provide the necessary supporting documentation.

THE SCHOOL REQUIRES THAT CERTAIN SENIOR LEADERSHIP RESIDE ON CAMPUS AS A CONDITION OF EMPLOYMENT FOR THE SAFETY AND SUPERVISION OF ITS STUDENTS, FACULTY AND OTHER CONSTITUENCIES WITHIN THE SCHOOL COMMUNITY OUTSIDE OF NORMAL BUSINESS HOURS. THESE RESIDENCES ALSO SERVE AS LOCATIONS FOR VARIOUS SCHOOL-RELATED EVENTS.

at the discretion of the board of directors and based upon the individual's performance as compared to expectations set by the board of directors, the headmaster was awarded a bonus during calendar year 2015.

IssuerName.BusinessNameLine1Txt: state of connecticut health and educational facilities authority

TaxExemptBondsIssuesGrp.PurposeDesc: Refunding of Series A and B tax exempt bond issues and related costs

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE AMOUNT IN COLUMN B REPRESENTS THE NUMBER OF CONTRIBUTORS.
THE SCHOOL MAINTAINS ACCOUNTS WITH THIRD PARTY FINANCIAL INSTITUTIONS WHICH ARE USED TO LIQUIDATE GIFTS OF MARKETABLE SECURITIES.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section A, line 2
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: Dee and Richard H. Gordon are directors who are related through marriage.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 11
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: the school's 990 is first reviewed by the cfo and controller. once any necessary edits have been made, the return is then provided to the treasurer and the finance committee for further review and approval. it is made available to the full board before it is filed.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 12c
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: ON AN ANNUAL BASIS, THE SECRETARY SHALL SEND TO EACH PERSON WHO IS A DIRECTOR OR OFFICER OF THE SCHOOL, AND TO THOSE KEY EMPLOYEES OF THE SCHOOL AS THE BOARD MAY DETERMINE, A COPY OF THIS POLICY REGARDING CONFLICT OF INTEREST, TOGETHER WITH A QUESTIONNAIRE INQUIRING AS TO CONFLICTS. ALL OTHER EMPLOYEES WILL BE MADE AWARE OF THE POLICY FROM THE DIRECTOR OF HUMAN RESOURCES, AND THEY SHOULD DISCLOSE ANY CONFLICTS OF INTEREST. IT SHALL BE THE DUTY OF EACH DIRECTOR, OFFICER AND KEY EMPLOYEE, AS THE CASE MAY BE, TO INFORM THE SECRETARY AND THE HEADMASTER OF ANY AND ALL CHANGES IN THE INFORMATION SET FORTH IN THE QUESTIONNAIRE OR OTHERWISE UPDATE THE SECRETARY IN A TIMELY FASHION. WHEN IN DOUBT AS TO WHETHER A CONFLICT OF INTEREST EXISTS, OR MAY EXIST, IT SHALL BE THE DUTY OF EACH PERSON TO INFORM THE SECRETARY OR HEADMASTER FOR CLARIFICATION.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 15
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: AVON OLD FARMS COMPENSATION GOAL PROVIDES A TOTAL COMPENSATION PROGRAM WHICH RECOGNIZES INDIVIDUAL PERFORMANCE AND MAINTAINS A COMPETITIVE MARKET POSITION. THE SCHOOL'S HUMAN RESOURCES DEPARTMENT UTILIZES THE FOLLOWING FACTORS TO ESTABLISH EMPLOYEE PAY LEVELS AND BENEFITS INCLUDING: MARKET SURVEY OF COMPARABLE POSITIONS AT COMPARABLE PRIVATE SCHOOLS, PERFORMANCE EVALUATIONS, REGIONAL COST OF LIVING DIFFERENTIALS, AS WELL AS RECRUITMENT AND RETENTION EXPERIENCE. THE BOARD'S EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE REVIEWS AND APPROVES THE EXECUTIVE AND KEY EMPLOYEES' COMPENSATION PACKAGES ANNUALLY.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section C, line 19
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE SCHOOL PROVIDES ALL GOVERNING DOCUMENTS, CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY, FINANCIAL STATEMENTS AND FORM 990 UPON REQUEST.
CHANGE IN VALUE OF SWAP AGREEMENT -1,369,202. PROVISION FOR UNCOLLECTIBLE PLEDGES -152,074.
There were no changes to the School's oversight or selection processes during the tax year.
